content:
Is https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/redirect in core, or does this contrib module provide different functionality?

backdrop-contrib/redirect
Redirects paths from one URL to another. Automatically creates redirects for changed aliases. - backdrop-contrib/redirect
It was added to core since 1.4. Not sure if the module does anything any longer.
...see https://backdropcms.org/user-guide/project-history#1.4
...perhaps the Bug Squad should add a dependency on system.module lower than 1.4, and then cut a release.

...perhaps the Bug Squad should add a dependency on system.module lower than 1.4, and then cut a release.

Please do!

I went through the list of module as they show up in the project browser (in other words only those with at least 1 release) and I'm making a to-do list of all those that will most likely need the same treatment:

  • https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/redirect (Geoff)
  • https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/rabbit_hole (@Laryn )
  • https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/flexible_layout (@docwilmot )
  • https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/submitted_by (@BWPanda )

  • https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/email_contactform (@jenlampton )
    These projects are already done (and can be used as examples):

  • https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/pathauto
    -- note already added in the README.md :+1:
    -- dependencies[] = system (< 1.1.0) already added to the .info file: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/pathauto/blob/1.x-1.x/pathauto.info#L9 :+1:
    -- change included in latest release: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/pathauto/releases/tag/1.x-1.2.3 :+1:

  • https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/options_element
    -- note already added in the README.md :+1:
    -- dependencies[] = system (<1.12) already added to the .info file: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/options_element/blob/1.x-1.x/options_element.info#L7 :+1:
    -- change included in latest release: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/options_element/releases/tag/1.x-1.0.1 :+1:
...I've pinged the respective module maintainers, in case you'd prefer to add dependencies[] = system ... and create a release yourselves. If not, then I'll eventually get to all of these for you.

...if you have insight and are aware of any reason that these modules are still required (for example, not all of their functionality has been merged to core), then please either let us know here, or take the time to add it as a note in the module README.md. Thanks :smile:

@klonos Submitted By was partly merged into core. The contrib module, in addition to core functionality:

  • Allows you to customise the submitted byline per display mode
  • Allows the submitted by pseudo field to be ordered in each display mode
Thanks for taking the time to clarify things @BWPanda ...do you think that it's worth adding that info in the module README?

...here's a PR for your review @BWPanda : https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/submitted_by/pull/7

Update README.md by klonos · Pull Request #7 · backdrop-contrib/submitted_by
As per discussion in Zulip: https://backdrop.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/218635-Backdrop/topic/Modules.20merged.20into.20core/near/224714811

Flexible layouts wasn't ported, really. The code and storage is totally different. Took some inspiration from the dialogs, and the name. That's about it. There'll be no upgrade path. The two should be able to coexist. And someone might prefer the complexity of the original.
Rabbit Hole works not only for node content but also user accounts and taxonomy. Also, it has more options than the 'Hidden path' setting of Backdrop core.

In the small number of modules I've ported, I've added a section "Differences from Drupal 7" to the README file when applicable. If a contrib module feature was adopted in core (and so removed from the module), I noted it there, an example being View Unpublished. Might be helpful to put something like that in modules similarly affected, where core now provides part of the functionality but there's a reason for the contrib module to still exist.
@klonos Looks fine, but I'm not the maintainer therefore I have no access to merge that PR.

Thanks for the info @docwilmot and @Olaf Grabienski :+1: ...and yes @bugfolder that's the goal, to let people know the difference(s) if any, and whether they need the module in newer versions of Backdrop or not.

@BWPanda sorry, I saw that the most recent commit and the 2 releases were by you, so I assumed that you still maintain the module. I can now see that the module lists no maintainer, so I'll just go ahead an merge/release. Thanks.
I really like @bugfolder 's documentation in the readme file. I wonder if we should add that to the readme example file in backdrop-contrib?
@klonos I don't think any of email_contactform was included in core. Where is your to-do list? Is it a meta issue?

I opened an issue for redirect: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/redirect/issues/25 The bug squad cannot make a release unless the module is unsupported.

Update readme, add core version requirement, crate a new release · Issue #25 · backdrop-contrib/redirect
From Zulip: @BWPanda Is https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/redirect in core, or does this contrib module provide different functionality? @klonos It was added to core since 1.4. Not sure if the mo...

The bug squad cannot make a release of any module that has a maintainer, and the [Redirect] readme shows a maintainer.

I think exceptions should be made when there hasn't been a release, let alone a commit, in 5 years...

Ok, I found https://backdropcms.org/user-guide/adopt-a-project and have opened an issue to determine the status of the module: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/redirect/issues/26

Is this module adandoned? · Issue #26 · backdrop-contrib/redirect
As per https://backdropcms.org/user-guide/adopt-a-project, I'd like to know if this module has been abandoned... @serundeputy Are you still maintaining this module and willing to make new relea...

Thanks for getting this going for the redirect module @jenlampton and @BWPanda :pray: ...and yes, I also like @bugfolder's documentation :+1: ...we could add a placeholder section in the README template for "differences from the D7 module" (if applicable)
